protocol.name: P-GSE20454-2
protocol.text: The logarithmic growth phase of the cultures was prolonged by either diluting the cultures or replenishing the media (media change). Samples were harvested at the indicated stages and cell pellets were snap frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at −80°C.

protocol.name: P-GSE20454-3
protocol.text: The growth of A. thaliana cultures was performed as described by Pellny et al., (2009).

protocol.name: P-GSE20454-4
protocol.text: Total RNA was extracted from frozen cell pellet using RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to manufacturer’s protocol.

protocol.name: P-GSE20454-5
protocol.text: Double-stranded cDNA was generated from each of the eighteen total-RNA samples and transcribed to obtain biotin-labeled cRNA.

protocol.name: P-GSE20454-6
protocol.text: The target cRNAs were fragmented, combined with hybridization and spike controls, then hybridized to the Genechip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array (Affymetrix, Inc., Santa Clara, CA) for 16 h. Following hybridization, the arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin phycoerythrin conjugate using an automated GeneChip® Fluidics Station 450

protocol.name: P-GSE20454-7
protocol.text: GeneChips were scanned with a GeneChip® Scanner 3000 7G using a 570 nm excitation wavelength laser. Microarray quality controls were assessed using GeneChip® Operating Software (Affymetrix)..

protocol.name: P-GSE20454-8
protocol.text: Raw intensity values from the scanned Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Arrays were analyzed using the Robust Multichip Average method (RMA).

protocol.name: P-GSE20454-9
protocol.text: A significance test was undertaken by calculating a null hypothesis through a permuted modified t-statistic across the replicates for each array comparison. The log2 means of the normalized intensity values of the biological replicates were compared as ratios, where a log2 ratio of ±1.0 and a p-value of < 0.01 was selected as worthy of further study.
